intro: Ionthlaspi clypeolatum, commonly known as the rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value. Ionthlaspi clypeolatum is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and withstand drought.
